secret_rule: Only items that are used in a standard yoga practice can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "yoga mat" and "yoga blocks".

The rule seems to be that you can bring any item that starts with the word "yoga" as long as it is commonly considered a piece of yoga equipment or accessory. This includes items like mats, blocks, straps, towels, socks, clothes, bolsters, wheels, bags, belts, cushions, and blankets, which are all related to yoga practice. However, you cannot bring items that aren't typically associated with yoga equipment, such as a "yoga book."
Correct! The rule is Only items that are used in a standard yoga practice can be brought to the picnic.
